p.s: The relationship between Abe and Amir starts with Abe and Amir being friendly with each other.
Abe tells Amir about his immigration status being up for renewal and Amir tries helping him by calling a lawyer, who knowknows how to react in such a situation.

After Abe asking Amir if he would work for the FBIFederal Bureau of Investigation and Amir says that he would at least considermaking them think he is on their side, Abe starts getting mad at him and starts thinking, that it was a mistake taking help from Amir.
In the following Abe says that being deported wouldn't even be that bad.

After Amir saying the USA would be a place for a better life, Abe loses controllcontrol anand says that they don't have a better life in the US and that he knows about him losing his job and beating Emily.
In the end Abe tells Amir that he will never fit in the US and the people will never fully accept him.
This makes Amir really upset and he trystries telling Abe that he cantcan't live out his religion in America.
To this Abe says that the prophet wouldn't copy people and rather made them copy him.
Afterwards Abe tells Amir he doesn't want his help and that he can do it himself.
You can say that after this part of the theatre Abe loses his respect for Amir that he once had.

About the attitude to American values and authorities you can say that Amir tries to follow the American values and helps the authorities, but Abe on the other side wants to stay with his old values from his home country and doesn't want to help the American authorities because they want to take away the values of him and his people.
In the end you can say, that Amir wanted to help Abe, but Abe declined his help after he told him to do everything he gets told to not get deported.
In the end Abe lost all the respect he once had for Amir.
